results.title: The Diary of Anne Frank
results.creator_credit: George Stevens and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A faithful screen translation of the Broadway play, based on the book, about the harrowing experiences of the Jewish Frank family and their friends when they are forced to hide from the Nazis in an Amsterdam factory for two years. Millie Perkins is visually perfect as the young Anne Frank whose spirit gives the group courage to continue when they lose hope.

results.title: Evil angels
results.creator_credit: Fred Schepisi, Jill Bilcock and Verity Lambert
results.brief_description: No body. No motive. No weapon. The facts in the Australian murder trial of Lindy and Michael Chamberlain didn’t add up. But strangely, other things did. Things like bigotry against the couple’s religion. Scattershot forensic evidence was accepted as fact. And a nationwide hysteria that was the 1980s equivalent of the Salem witchhunt. Much of “Evil Angels” has the bizarre ring of the tabloid headlines. The wholesale abandonment of reason and justice seems too preposterous to be possible in a free and modern country. Believe it. It’s documented in John Bryson’s book “Evil Angels”. Stars Meryl Streep and Sam Neill.

results.title: Rain man
results.creator_credit: Barry Levinson, Mark Johnson, Guber-Peters Company and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: My father has stuck it to me all my life, complains Charlie Babbitt, a callous self-centred young hustler who feels he’s been cheated. After his father’s death, Charlie’s inheritance comprises of prized rose bushes and a vintage ‘49 Buick convertible. Charlie soon uncovers yet another surprise - a brother he never knew he had. Dustin Hoffman’s Oscar winning portrayal of Raymond, an autistic savant living in a world devoid of human perceptions, may well be the crowning achievement of his distinguished career. Discovering Raymond in an institution, Charlie abducts him in a last ditch effort to extort his “fair share” of the family estate. What begins as an unsentimental journey across the country, evolves into a mystical odyssey of love and self revelation as Raymond forces Charlie to grow beyond the limits of his own handicapped heart. Stars Dustin Hoffman and Tom Cruise.

results.title: Rambo III (Captioned)
results.brief_description: John Rambo (Sylvester Stallone) finds himself caught in the war torn Middle East, after his longtime friend, Colonel Trautmen falls into Russian hands. The Soviets, equipped with state-of-the-art weapons, horrifying hi-tech helicopters, tanks and an army of highly trained men, are capable of annihilating any opposition they encounter. However, Rambo is no ordinary soldier, he’s a one-man army who will face the Russians head-on in the most awesome confrontation of his life.

results.title: The Name of the Rose (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Jean-Jacques Annaud, Thomas Schuhly, Cristaldifilm, Films Ariane, Neue Constantin Filmproduktion and Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen
results.brief_description: Sean Connery plays a Brother who is sent to investigate the mysterious deaths of two of the monks at a monastery. He discovers a secret library containing rare books considered lost to the world and dangerous to the Catholic faith. He must find a connection between the deaths and the books before a Catholic Inquisitor (played by F. Murray Abraham) burns innocent people at the stake. Secret passages, forbidden sexual adventures, labyrinths and arsenic are drawn together to create this tale of suspense and intrigue. Based on the novel by Umberto Eco.

results.title: Hamlet (Kozintsev)
results.brief_description: In the opening sequence of this production the whole line of the film is boldly laid down. Hamlet gallops across the sands towards Elsinore, and into the great sombre castle; Claudius’ rule is proclaimed in the crowded courtyard; the drawbridge is slowly pulled up, shutting the castle in on itself. Where Kozintsev scores, consistently and impressively is through the elements outlined in the film’s vigorous introduction; the way he involves the onlookers of Elsinore in the action, and the way he uses the castle and the court to create a feeling of encirclement by iron, stone and the watchful eye of the courtiers. The emphasis is on speed, clarity, the flow of visual action. It cuts a firm, slashing line through the play.

results.title: King Lear
results.brief_description: Kozintsev approached the play by creating a total environment for his characters to dwell in - a vast no-man’s land of moor and marsh populated by small communities in primitive castles and clusters of farm dwellings. He has made a superb film which from its beginning portends a tottering natural order and is filled with true Shakespearian energy, a mood doubly enhanced by the splendid score by Shostakovich which lifts the film onto an epic plane. In Russian with English subtitles.

results.title: The Mission (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Roland Joffe, David Puttnam and Fernando Ghia
results.brief_description: A man of the sword. A man of the cloth. A clash of civilisations. A fight to the death. A political parable and portrait of 18th century missionary works. Shot on location in the breathtaking jungles of South America. “The Mission” is a movie experience to be shared by all. Stars Robert de Niro and Jeremy Irons.
